forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 15 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the early hours transition into dawn over Downtown San Francisco, the city is enveloped in a damp embrace, with rain showering the streets and a persistent cloud cover cloaking the skyline. The chill in the air brings a reminder of winter’s touch, as temperatures linger near fifty degrees, met with gusty winds that occasionally whip through the alleyways, rustling leaves and carrying the scent of the Pacific. With a significant chance for rain throughout the day, one can expect puddles to gather on the sidewalks and the golden hues of the sunset to be obscured by an unyielding blanket of gray clouds.

The day ahead promises not much respite, as drizzles are likely to continue, tapering off only slightly in the afternoon. Highs will hover near fifty-seven, falling gradually under the pressure of the encroaching chill. Dress warmly, layering appropriately to face the cool air, perhaps opting for a waterproof jacket and comfortable boots to navigate the slick streets. While the atmospheric drab might not inspire lengthy strolls along the waterfront, it offers a unique opportunity to explore cozy spots. Consider spending a leisurely afternoon in an intimate café with a good book, or venturing into the warmth of a local gallery. Indoor activities such as browsing antique shops or sampling fare at a nearby bistro make for delightful alternatives on this rain-soaked day.
